content.raw: I checked everywhere we're using `const_iterator` and it it doesn't look like we need the `const` so I'm okay with not enforcing. I would then suggest to do `auto iter` instead of `const auto iter` then to avoid confusion.
content.html: I checked everywhere we're using const_iterator and it it doesn't look like we need the const so I'm okay with not enforcing. I would then suggest to do auto iter instead of const auto iter then to avoid confusion.

pull_request.title: Clean up a few clang-tidy checks

pullrequest.title: Clean up a few clang-tidy checks

content.raw:
Interesting, I checked in godbolt, and you are correct.  I'm not sure that the `const`-ness is really required or helping here, so maybe it would be okay to not enforce.

Thoughts?
content.html:
Interesting, I checked in godbolt, and you are correct. I'm not sure that the const-ness is really required or helping here, so maybe it would be okay to not enforce.

Thoughts?

content.raw: I believe `const auto iter` is not the same as ` std::map<ComponentId, int>::const_iterator`. Maybe we could do `auto iter = std::as_const(this->idMap).find(_id)`
content.html: I believe const auto iter is not the same as std::map<ComponentId, int>::const_iterator. Maybe we could do auto iter = std::as_const(this->idMap).find(_id)

content.raw: Correct.  I also made the separate `build_tidy` dir in the script because the `coverage` build introduces some GCC flags that clang then chokes on.  Fortunately, it doesn’t require a rebuild, just another cmake call.
content.html: Correct. I also made the separate build_tidy dir in the script because the coverage build introduces some GCC flags that clang then chokes on. Fortunately, it doesn’t require a rebuild, just another cmake call.

pullrequest.title: Clean up a few clang-tidy checks

content.raw:
Actually I was talking to @carromj that the header filter is not really working for me locally or on pipelines. We're getting errors from other headers, like:

~~~
Error while processing /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/src/EventManager_TEST.cc.
warning: dynamic exception specification '' is deprecated; consider using 'noexcept' instead [modernize-use-noexcept]
error: unknown argument: '-fno-implicit-inline-templates' [clang-diagnostic-error]
/usr/include/wchar.h:35:10: error: 'stddef.h' file not found [clang-diagnostic-error]
#include <stddef.h>
~~~

Is the filter working for you?
content.html:
Actually I was talking to @carromj that the header filter is not really working for me locally or on pipelines. We're getting errors from other headers, like:

Error while processing /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/src/EventManager_TEST.cc.
warning: dynamic exception specification '' is deprecated; consider using 'noexcept' instead [modernize-use-noexcept]
error: unknown argument: '-fno-implicit-inline-templates' [clang-diagnostic-error]
/usr/include/wchar.h:35:10: error: 'stddef.h' file not found [clang-diagnostic-error]
#include <stddef.h>

Is the filter working for you?

content.raw:
Mind adding some notes to the readme on how to run clang-tidy? And how about running it on pipelines?

After a while, if we're happy with this, we could integrate it into `ign-cmake`'s `make codecheck`
content.html:
Mind adding some notes to the readme on how to run clang-tidy? And how about running it on pipelines?

After a while, if we're happy with this, we could integrate it into ign-cmake's make codecheck
